alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Greenville Mountains; Northern Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Greenville and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 803 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Columbus, or 5 miles north of Lake Robinson, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Landrum, Inman, Campobello, Tigerville, Lake Robinson, Lake Bowen, Gowensville and Glassy Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Greenville; Greenville Mountains; Northern Spartanburg
